image.altText: Mr Rudd is looking directly at the camera, wearing glasses and a blue tie.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has toughened his language about Kevin Rudd's appointment as Australia's ambassador to the US, after a top Trump aide appeared to suggest his time in the role was coming to an end.

title.children: Dutton pins Rudd's appointment to US on Albanese, as Trump loyalist taunts former PM

image.altText: a man with large spectacles and suit

props.synopsis: Nouriel Roubini predicted the Global Financial Crisis, now he is warning president-elect Donald Trump's tariff and deregulation plans could lead to stagflation.

title.children: Economist who predicted GFC warns about Trump's economic plans

image.altText: Job ads in a newspaper.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remained at 4.1pc in October, as 15,900 more people found employment.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate remained steady in October at 4.1pc

image.altText: Snapchat icon on a smartphone screen.

props.synopsis: Communications Minister Michelle Rowland has been asked if Snapchat could be exempt from the social media ban if it fell under the definition of a messaging service. Follow live.

title.children: 'Extraordinary': Concerns Snapchat could be exempt from social media ban

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Marles thinks Rudd will still be ambassador when Trump is sworn as president
'Extraordinary': Shadow Communications Minister over possible Snapchat exemptions
'Wait and see': Dutton questions Rudd's future as ambassador

image.altText: Donald Trump and Joe Biden sit in the Oval Office and shake hands.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden welcomes his long-time nemesis, Donald Trump, back to the White House for an undoubtedly uncomfortable Oval Office meeting to discuss the transition of power.

title.children: 'It's a nice world today': Trump meets Biden at White House before appointing more loyalists to key roles

image.altText: Chef Jamie Oliver standing holding his new book wide open pretending to read it

props.synopsis: Jamie Oliver has become embroiled in controversy after criticism his new book stereotypes Indigenous Australians. Here's where it all went wrong.

title.children: Penguin didn't put Jamie Oliver's children's book through a sensitivity check. That's where it all went wrong

image.altText: Two hands hold a piggy bank full of coins.

props.synopsis: Superannuation funds have faced a Senate committee after a lawsuit was launched against Cbus. Australia's unemployment rate has held steady at 4.1pc in October.  Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: 'Far from perfect': Cbus execs apologise before senate inquiry, Bitcoin sets new record

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AFP has broken into a crypto wallet to seize $9 million

image.altText: Damien Richardson speaking

props.synopsis: Former actor Damien Richardson is being investigated by Victoria Police after being filmed jokingly performing the Nazi salute at an event attended by some Neo-Nazis.

title.children: Former soap star filmed doing Nazi salute at event far-right activists attended

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Patrick Orren Stephenson, 23, has pleaded not guilty to a charge of murder after the disappearance of Ballarat mum Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Husband in courtroom as man accused of murdering Samantha Murphy pleads not guilty

image.altText: Matt Gaetz wears a suit, sunglasses and white 'MAGA' baseball cap in a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: It's a decades-old White House tradition, but the meeting between Biden and Trump was nothing short of remarkable. And there were still surprises to come.

title.children: 'Welcome back': Trump's return to the Oval Office was historic, but there were surprises still to come

image.altText: A man carrying a kangaroo that has burned and bandaged paws.

props.synopsis: Areas that had multiple fires prior to 2019–20 had greater biodiversity losses when Black Summer fires hit compared to areas that had burnt once or not all beforehand.

title.children: Prescribed burns are used to reduce bushfire risk. A new study suggests it has the opposite effect

image.altText: A young Asian woman looks into the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: After a new survey revealed half of migrant women had experienced sexual harassment in Australian workplaces, workers are speaking out and calling for change.

title.children: These women were groped at work then told it's just part of Australian culture

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A staff member at the Cooma aged care facility where Clare Nowland was tasered by a police officer tells a jury the elderly woman had thrown a knife at her beforehand.

title.children: Court told 95yo threw a knife at aged care worker in the hours before being tasered by police officer

image.altText: A bag of iv fluids in a veterinary clinic.

props.synopsis: Doctors say they've been forced to ration care as sourcing the essential medicine continues to prove a challenge.

title.children: IV vitamin drips used to make 'expensive urine' even as GPs battle shortage

image.altText: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby wears a purple top and chain with a cross as he walks in Westminster

props.synopsis: A man who survived abuse as a child at the hands of his Anglican priest says the Church should "beg" for forgiveness after it a report revealed that the Archbishop of Canterbury had knowledge of sexual abuse at Christian camps.

title.children: Child abuse survivor says Anglican Church should have learnt from Australia's Royal Commission

image.altText: A scuba diver swims alongside a giant brown undulating standalone coral.

props.synopsis: Scientists say they have discovered the world's largest coral — measuring longer than a blue whale — on an expedition in Solomon Islands.

title.children: Scientists discover 'astonishingly large' coral thought to be biggest in the world

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising out of a residential district full of apartment blocks in Beirut.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah strongholds in Beirut have endured another day of Israeli bombardment, as Lebanon waited to hear details of a proposed ceasefire from the US.

title.children: Six Israeli soldiers killed in Lebanon as Beirut hit by second day of air strikes

image.altText: A man looking on, seen from close up.

props.synopsis: The Sea Shepherd and Greenpeace co-founder has been detained since July, with supporters worried a move to extradite him to Japan would see him live the rest of his life in prison.

title.children: 'Delay, delay, delay': Paul Watson has detention extended for another three weeks in Greenland, dismaying supporters

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un walking through a rose garden together.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un announced a mutual defence agreement earlier this year, which has paved the way for an estimated 10,000 North Korean troops to join in Russia's fight against Ukraine.

title.children: US vows 'firm response' to North Korean deployment on Ukraine front line

image.altText: A passenger checks a flight information board showing flights cancelled due to the eruption of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki

props.synopsis: Flights in and out of Bali are resuming today after volcanic eruptions clouded parts of Indonesia with dangerous ash clouds and forced Australian airlines to cancel trips.

title.children: Flights in and out of Bali resume after volcanic eruptions

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: Championing higher wages is in Labor's DNA, but wage growth may not be able to overcome inflation anger if a rate cut doesn't arrive soon.

title.children: Wages are growing faster than inflation, but will it feel that way to voters?

image.altText: Gregory Geason on mobile phone outside court.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian judge Gregory Geason has been sentenced to a 12-month community corrections order with 100 hours of community work for assaulting and emotionally abusing a woman.

title.children: 'You have not demonstrated any remorse': Supreme Court judge sentenced after being found guilty of assaulting woman

image.altText: A teenage boy with blonde hair and wearing a black collared shirt shows his phone Hamish Blake who's sitting down

props.synopsis: You'll remember The Assembly's Dylan from his volley of questions to some of Australia's biggest names. Dylan joined the Compass team as an intern, where he was on the hunt for fame, filmmaking skills and funds to buy more bricks.

title.children: Fame, fun and minifigs: The Assembly's Dylan interns with Compass

image.altText: fire rescue victoria fire truck at station

props.synopsis: A system used to locate and track Fire Rescue Victoria vehicles is no longer operational, with the firefighters union saying the service did not update technology in time for the 3G shutdown.

title.children: Victorian firefighters locked out of stations and truck tracking system rendered obsolete by 3G network shutdown

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: The man and woman, both in their 60s, were found dead in a hot, dry creek bed only 2.5 kilometres from their vehicle.

title.children: 'They’d used all their water': Bodies of man and woman found in outback Queensland

image.altText: A black dog stands close to the camera while wearing a harness with a handle being held by a person in biege shorts.

props.synopsis: Peter Frank and his dog are seeking compensation and "change" after two drivers refused to pick him up at Melbourne Airport in 2023.

title.children: Uber being sued after drivers 'point-blank' refuse rides to Melbourne teacher and his assistance dog

image.altText: A silhouetted crowd standing in the morning mist, holding up large flags.

props.synopsis: Activists are protesting proposed changes to New Zealand's foundational document, the Treaty of Waitangi. But is the bill more bark than bite?

title.children: What a controversial law change in New Zealand could mean for Māori people

image.altText: Traditional Indigenous art in Nullarbor Caves.

props.synopsis: The new South Coast Marine Park has a hole in it to facilitate a yet-to-be-approved renewables project in a region some scientists believe warrants inclusion on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

title.children: Scientist concerned massive green energy hub could 'destroy' the Nullarbor

image.altText: Two women sit on council

props.synopsis: The deputy mayor says the council is "bleeding money" as it faces a $37 million operating deficit after several natural disasters, and the potential of large termination payments.

title.children: NSW council CEO resigns amid financial crisis as union claims up to 500 jobs at risk

image.altText: Mildura's five women councillors pictured in front of a red brick wall.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government's goal of having an equal number of men and women in local government has fallen well short, especially in regional areas.

title.children: Victoria fails to reach goal of gender parity on councils ahead of 2025 deadline

image.altText: A house with Shawline Publishing's logo out the front, there is also a For Lease sign.

props.synopsis: Authors who had their books published through a company that has gone into liquidation say they are thousands of dollars out of pocket.

title.children: Hundreds of Australian authors out of pocket after Victorian publisher's collapse

image.altText: Adnyamathanha elder Uncle Charles Jackson.

props.synopsis: It has been almost one month since Port Augusta became a Declared Public Precinct, but Uncle Charles Jackson OAM says the move simply shifts the issues "out of sight".

title.children: 'It's directed at First Nations people': Elder shares concerns about Declared Public Precinct in Port Augusta

image.altText: A composite image of a young man singing into a microphone, a cartoon blue dog and a man with brown hair and a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: From Rage's first guest programmer to Bluey's rock frontman, get your buzzers ready, music fans — it's time for the Spicks and Specks quiz!

title.children: How well do you know Australian music? Test your knowledge with the Spicks and Specks quiz
